Significance: Will begin a period of Muslim rule in the [Al-Andalus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Andalus ) (with various portions of the [Iberian peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iberian_peninsula )) until nearly the end of the [Fifteenth Century](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fifteenth_Century ).

The combined [Byzantine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine )â€“[Bulgarian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulgarians ) forces stop the Arab threat in [Southeastern Europe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southeastern_Europe ).

Event: [Iconoclast movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iconoclasm ) begun in the Byzantine Empire under [Leo III](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leo_III_the_Isaurian ). This was opposed by [Pope Gregory II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Gregory_II ), and an important difference between the Roman and Byzantine churches.

Significance: Significant moment that led to the forming of the [Carolingian Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carolingian_Empire ) for the Franks, and halted the advancement of the Moors in southwestern Europe.
Bede was later regarded as 'the father of English history'.
Would become the longest-lasting caliphate, until 1519 when conquered and annexed into the [Ottoman Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ottoman_Empire ).

Event: Pepin promises the Pope central Italy. This is arguably the beginning of the temporal power of the Papacy.

Significance: Caused the death of [Roland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roland ), and elevated him into legend, becoming the role model for [knights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knights ) and influencing the code of [chivalry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chivalry ) in the [Middle Ages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_Ages ).

Event: Accession of [Harun al-Rashid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harun_al-Rashid ) to the Caliphate in Baghdad.

Significance: Generally considered the beginning of the [Viking Age](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viking_Age ) that would span over two centuries, and reach as far south as [Hispania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hispania ) and as far east as the [Byzantine Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Empire ), and present-day [Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia ).
Considered to be the last classical period of [History of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_History ). Chinese influence was at its strongest during this era in Japan.
Marks the end of [Mercian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercia ) dominance in England.

With his crowning, [Charlemagne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlemagne )'s kingdom is officially recognized by the Papacy as the largest in Europe since the fall of the [Roman Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_Empire ).

Event: [Gunpowder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunpowder ) is invented in China (somewhere around 9th century)
